settingsPane.description: Intelliplug Hotplug is an intelligient and better hotlug driver then stock mpdecision driver. Recommended for better power saving.
settingsPane.name: Intelliplug Hotplug Driver

spinner.description: Intelliplug conflicts with stock mpdecision. It is HIGHLY recommended to stop mpdecision after enabling Intelliplug. Also, if intelliplug is active on reboot, we will take care stopping mpdecision for you.
spinner.name: Intelliplug Driver

button.description: This button helps enabling/disabling mpdecision. Simply tap it whenever you switch Intelliplug state above.
button.name: mpdecision
button.label: Enable/Disable mpdecision

spinner.description: Eco Mode is a special power savings mode part of the intelli_plug where the kernel automatically reconfigures its decisions in real time and optimizes to use only 2 out of 4 cores. Cores 3 and 4 are turned off completely. Recommended on for power saving and off for performance.
spinner.name: Eco Mode

settingsPane.description: zRAM increases performance by avoiding paging on disk and instead uses a compressed block device in RAM in which paging takes place until it is necessary to use the swap space.
settingsPane.name: zRAM

spinner.description: zRAM Module settings. Here, you can enable/disable ZRAM or add more compressed RAM for your system. (Default: 50 MB)
spinner.name: ZRAM Settings

spinner.description: If you have enabled swap, higher number = the more the system will swap. Keeping swappiness '0' means swapping occurs only when your device runs out of memory, increasing swappiness will result more battery consumption. Please note SWAP is effective only if zRAM is ON.(Default: 0)
spinner.name: swappiness

settingsPane.description: UKSM is new technique for KSM.
settingsPane.name: UKSM

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable 'Ultra KSM Control'. This will merge some memory but consumes more CPU and battery. You will need to reboot your device for changes to take effect.
checkbox.name: Ultra KSM Control
checkbox.label: Ultra KSM Control

button.description: Ultra KSM state check. Memory samepage merging is not quick process. So, stats may show 0 MB initially.
button.name: Ultra KSM STATS
button.label: Ultra KSM Stats

button.description: Clean RAM cache. This will release all cached and buffered RAM
button.name: CLEAN RAM CACHE
button.label: Clean RAM Cache

spinner.description: This option enables the doubletap2wake (AKA KnockKnock) feature (may cause more battery drain when in pocket)
spinner.name: DT2W

spinner.description: This option enables the sweep2wake feature (may cause more battery drain when in pocket)
spinner.name: S2W

seekBar.description: This slider sets start position of S2W. Default 400.
seekBar.name: Start Position

seekBar.description: This slider sets start position of S2W. Default 700.
seekBar.name: Mid Position

seekBar.description: This slider sets start position of S2W. Default 830.
seekBar.name: End Position

seekBar.description: This slider sets threshold of S2W. Default 250.
seekBar.name: Threshold

spinner.description: This option selects orientation of S2W. Please note you will need adjust co-ordinates accordingly. Default Horizontal.
spinner.name: Orientation

settingsPane.description: This section controls miscellaneous tweaks of the device.
settingsPane.name: Misc Tweaks

spinner.description: Enable/Disable Dynamic File Sync. While screen is on, file sync is temporarily deferred, when screen is off, a flush is called to synchronize all outstanding writes. Please note: There may be loss of slight data if device reboots abruptly when Dynamic Fsync is enabled.
spinner.name: Dynamic FSync

spinner.description: This option allows some cheap USB chargers with > 500ma to be recognized as an AC charger in order to charge at a faster rate.
spinner.name: Fast Charge

settingsPane.description: Here, you can load kernel modules on boot that will allow some extra functions.
settingsPane.name: Kernel Modules

checkbox.description: Enable/Disable Exfat module load on boot.

checkbox.label: EXFAT Module

button.description: This displays the currently loaded modules.
button.name: Show Loaded Modules
button.label: Show Loaded Modules

button.description: This button tries to force-load selected modules in the memory without requiring a reboot. This may not help, because most modules requires a reboot. This button is primarily for testing purposes.
button.name: Force-Load Modules
